intro: Bionia pedicellata, commonly known as the clustered bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or violet flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in clusters around the stem. Bionia pedicellata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
